result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Dewayne Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence; credit for 91 days served.
Court recommends supervision through the Mental Health unit.

miscConds.notes:
-  Court waives non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.
-  Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. If confinement is served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC).
- COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

-  No illegal substances.
-  No Contact Order with Marquette University Campus.
-  No Contact Order with U.S. Post Office, 1301 North 12th Street, City of Milwaukee.
-  No Contact Order with the 7-ELEVEN store at 1624 W. Wells Street, City of Milwaukee.
-  No Violent or Verbally Abusive Contact with the Milwaukee County Transit System.
-  No Contact Order with Phillip C.
-  No Contact Order with The Guest House, 1216 N. 13th Street, City of Milwaukee.

-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy.
-  Take all medications as prescribed.
-  Work with the agent to establish stable housing.

-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
-  Absolute Sobriety.
-  Random urine screens.
-  Breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Dewayne Griffin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Anthony Dewayne Griffin.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on doctors report.  State does not dispute the findings. Due to reasons stated on the record, defense has not been able to successfully go over the doctor's report with client to determine their position. Court adjourned for contested doctors report hearing. Doctor and defense counsel is authorized to appear by zoom on the next scheduled court date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D., ABPP dated September 15, 2022 - received

Case in court for status conference.  Request for a Competency Determination filed.  Defense requesting competency evaluation.  Case scheduled for doctor's report return.  Defendant to appear by zoom.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Request for a Competency Determination filed on August 2, 2022.  Case is scheduled for a status conference; both parties agree to date.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Swanson, Br. 11, calendar successor, for review. mag
DHA request for competency determination filed by ALJ Christine L. Hansen
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve  12  months  in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for  91  days served. 
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  2  years  with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Court recommends supervision through the Mental Health unit
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  Take all medications as prescribed
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random urine screens
-  Breathalyzers
-  No illegal substances
-  Work with the agent to establish stable housing
-  No Contact Order with Marquette University Campus
-  No Contact Order with U.S. Post Office, 1301 North 12th Street, City of Milwaukee.
-  No Contact Order with the 7-ELEVEN store at 1624 W. Wells Street, City of Milwaukee
-  No Violent or Verbally Abusive Contact with the Milwaukee County Transit System
-  No Contact Order with Phillip C.
-  No Contact Order with The Guest House, 1216 N. 13th Street, City of Milwaukee
-  Court waives non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
if confinement is served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC).

Appeal rights given.

Defendant has five cases before the court.

As to Count  1:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Counts 2, 3 and 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts 2, 3 and 4   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
Case recalled; Asst. District Attorney Geocaris appears via Zoom video; defendant, in custody (appears via Zoom video)

Court reviews doctor's report with the parties and holds colloquy with defendant.

There being no challenge to the report by the State, defense counsel or defendant Court adopts the professional opinion of the examiner's that the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in his defense. 
Court finds defendant competent to proceed and orders the proceedings reinstated.  

Parties are prepared to proceed to initial appearance.

Case recalled; Asst. District Attorney Geocaris now present via Zoom video.

Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance.
Defense counsel advises Court that he has reviewed the doctor's report with the defendant.
State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.

Court is advised that initial appearance has not yet been held as to this case.

Case passed.

Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Anthony Dewayne Griffin in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Anthony Dewayne Griffin in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Dewayne Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney.   Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.
